article.description: Brian Skinner grabbed the spotlight from his more heralded teammates.
article.headline: Skinner scores season-high 20 points in Philly rout
article.linkText: Here's the skinny: Sixers' forward grabs spotlight
article.story:
MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Brian Skinner grabbed the spotlight from his more heralded teammates.
 
Skinner
Skinner had a season-high 20 points and a game-high 14 rebounds, leading the Philadelphia 76ers to a 108-81 rout of the Milwaukee Bucks on Tuesday night. "He was phenomenal," Philadelphia coach Larry Brown said. "I've had his minutes pretty spotty lately and I'm going to try to get him more consistent playing time ... and he's playing on a bad ankle." It hardly showed, as Skinner dominated inside. He scored eight points in the first 7:33 on the way to a season high, surpassing the 17 points he scored Jan. 2, also against Milwaukee. Skinner was 9-of-11 from the field. Keith Van Horn led the 76ers with 24 points and Allen Iverson had 20. Philadelphia never trailed. Iverson heaped praise on Skinner. "He did a great job," Iverson said. "He gave us the energy we needed as far as rebounding and getting the loose balls. He scored for us and it was one of his best efforts of the year." Skinner said, "They gave me the ball in the post, that was the main thing. I've been working on that, trying to focus on it instead of just getting second-chance points." The 76ers had a whopping 52-23 edge in rebounds as Milwaukee tied its franchise low for rebounds. "They just dominated us on the boards," Michael Redd said. "It was a poor night of rebounding by us." The 76ers, who lost their last three at home, won their fourth straight on the road and handed the Bucks only their second loss in 10 games. Ray Allen scored 18 points, Tim Thomas 14 and Redd 12 for the Bucks. In going 8-1 in their previous nine games, the Bucks held all their opponents under 100 points. But they allowed a season-high 34 points in the first quarter and scored a season low 16. The 76ers held Milwaukee to one field goal while building a 19-3 lead midway through the first. They scored the final nine points of the second quarter to lead 61-34 at halftime. The Bucks closed to 17 in the third quarter, but five straight points by Skinner made it 77-55. It was 84-63 after three quarters, and the 76ers opened the fourth with a 7-0 run, starting with a three-point play by Skinner. Milwaukee, which made 13 3-pointers in Monday night's 108-93 win at New Orleans, was 1-of-10 in the first half and 6-of-23 overall from behind the arc. "Philly was on a mission and we didn't respond," Redd said. "You've got to bring it every night, and we should come out every game like Philly did tonight." Game notes
Allen's three-year run on the All-Star team ended when no Bucks were selected Tuesday. ... Iverson didn't accompany the team on its flight Monday due to the illness of his mother. He arrived Tuesday. ... The Bucks, who started an eight-game homestand, finished 6-0 on the road in January, the first time since December 1981 they were undefeated in a calendar month. ... The season series ended tied at 2.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
